id.kaytrust.core.identity.ethereum.client

Class EthereumIdentityConsumerImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • id.kaytrust.core.identity.ethereum.client.EthereumIdentityConsumerImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IdentityConsumer, EthereumIdentityConsumer

    public class EthereumIdentityConsumerImpl
extends Object
implements EthereumIdentityConsumer
    This class represents an implementation of EthereumIdentityConsumer; it defines specific methods to check authorization levels (capabilities) that user's devices have over identities deployed on the ethereum network and mapped in a specific instance of a Identity Manager smart contract.

    This implementation is fully compatible with any ethereum network.

    Author:
    Edgard Espinoza, Erick Pacheco

      Constructors

      EthereumIdentityConsumerImpl(String hostRpc, String token, String... contractAddresses)
      Sets the identity Manager wrapper instances to interact with the Identity Manager smart contracts deployed in the ethereum network.

      boolean checkIdentityToken(String jwt, String audience, String capability)
      First, the process verifies if a "jwt" contains a required "audience" (specified in the "aud" field in the jwt); if so the did (subject field of the jwt), the device's address (processed from the "iss" field in the jwt) and the capability ("cap" field in the jwt) are extracted from the jwt.

      Verifies if an address device (derived from the "devicePublicKey") is authorized with a specified "capability" for a proxy smart contract whose address is embedded in the "did" parameter.

      • EthereumIdentityConsumerImpl

        public EthereumIdentityConsumerImpl(String hostRpc,
                                    String token,
                                    String... contractAddresses)
        Sets the identity Manager wrapper instances to interact with the Identity Manager smart contracts deployed in the ethereum network.
        Parameters:
        hostRpc - host and port where ethereum node serves RPC requests
        token - can be blank, is token field Authorization
        contractAddresses - List of contract addresses where the Identity Manager smart contracts live.

      • getIdentityManagerFromDid

        public String getIdentityManagerFromDid(String did)
                                 throws MnidInvalidAddressException,
                                        IOException
        At a high level; an Identity Manager wrapper is returned.

        If the "did" argument has been already registered on some of the identity Manager smart contracts that a running instance of this class has registered when setting the "instance" method, then a wrapper to interact with that identity Manager contract is returned.

        Parameters:
        did - The Decentralized identifier
        Returns:
        Returns a java Identity Manager instance.
        Throws:
        IOException - network exception
        MnidInvalidAddressException - mnid format error

      • isDeviceAuthorized

        public boolean isDeviceAuthorized(String did,
                                  String devicePublicKey,
                                  String capability)
                           throws MnidInvalidAddressException,
                                  IOException
        Verifies if an address device (derived from the "devicePublicKey") is authorized with a specified "capability" for a proxy smart contract whose address is embedded in the "did" parameter.
        Specified by:
        isDeviceAuthorized in interface IdentityConsumer
        Parameters:
        did - The Decentralized identifier
        devicePublicKey - The device's public key
        capability - The capability to query in the smart contract.
        Returns:
        true if the device address is authorized, false otherwise
        Throws:
        IOException - network exception
        MnidInvalidAddressException - mnid format error

      • checkIdentityToken

        public boolean checkIdentityToken(String jwt,
                                  String audience,
                                  String capability)
                           throws InvalidKeyException,
                                  NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                  SignatureException,
                                  NoSuchProviderException,
                                  InvalidKeySpecException,
                                  JwtExpirationException,
                                  JwtVerifyException,
                                  AudienceException,
                                  MnidInvalidAddressException,
                                  IOException,
                                  ParamEmptyException
        First, the process verifies if a "jwt" contains a required "audience" (specified in the "aud" field in the jwt); if so the did (subject field of the jwt), the device's address (processed from the "iss" field in the jwt) and the capability ("cap" field in the jwt) are extracted from the jwt. The extracted fields (did, address and capability) are used to make a second verification that is defined according to a specific implementation of this interface.
        Specified by:
        checkIdentityToken in interface IdentityConsumer
        Parameters:
        jwt - access token jwt
        audience - aud who receive jwt
        capability - capability as fw,
        Returns:
        true or false if jwt
        Throws:
        AudienceException - audience incorrect
        JwtVerifyException - jwt is not valid
        JwtExpirationException - jwt is expired
        InvalidKeySpecException - Invalid Key Spec
        NoSuchProviderException - No Such Provider
        SignatureException - Signature error
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - No Such Algorithm
        InvalidKeyException - Invalid Key
        IOException - io exception
        MnidInvalidAddressException - mnid format error
        ParamEmptyException - if a required parameter is empty.
